Package bricker.brick_strategies

Class DoublePowersStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • bricker.brick_strategies.BasicCollisionStrategy
      • bricker.brick_strategies.DoublePowersStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CollisionStrategy
    public class DoublePowersStrategy
extends BasicCollisionStrategy
    DoublePowersStrategy is a collision strategy class extending BasicCollisionStrategy. It's designed to amplify the impact of game elements upon collision by initiating two different collision strategies simultaneously. This strategy effectively "doubles" the gameplay effect, adding an extra layer of challenge and unpredictability. Upon a collision event, this strategy triggers two random collision strategies, thereby doubling the game's response to that collision. This can lead to various gameplay changes, such as additional balls, changes in camera perspective, etc., enhancing the gameplay experience. Usage: - Instantiate this class with the game manager. - Attach this strategy to a GameObject. - When a collision occurs, the strategy triggers two other strategies, creating a compounded effect.
    Version:
    Java 11
    Author:
    Noam Shabat, Samuel Hayat

    • Constructor Detail

      • DoublePowersStrategy

        public DoublePowersStrategy​(danogl.collisions.GameObjectCollection admin,
                            BrickerGameManager gameManager,
                            danogl.util.Counter numberOfDoubleEventOccurred)
        Constructor for the DoublePowersStrategy class. Initializes the strategy with the game manager and the administration GameObjectCollection.
        Parameters:
        admin - The GameObjectCollection used for administrative purposes in the game.
        gameManager - The main game manager, responsible for managing game states and interactions. It is essential for creating and applying different collision strategies.
        numberOfDoubleEventOccurred - The number that is being counted for the number of double events that happened.

    • Method Detail

      • getTag

        public java.lang.String getTag()
        Returns a unique tag identifying this specific strategy. This tag can be used for debugging or identifying the strategy during the game.
        Specified by:
        getTag in interface CollisionStrategy
        Overrides:
        getTag in class BasicCollisionStrategy
        Returns:
        A string representing the tag of this collision strategy.

      • onCollision

        public void onCollision​(danogl.GameObject thisObj,
                        danogl.GameObject otherObj,
                        danogl.util.Counter bricksCounter,
                        boolean originalBehavior)
        Handles the collision event by triggering two separate collision strategies, thereby "doubling" the effect. This method is invoked when a collision occurs with an object implementing this strategy. It selects and applies two random collision strategies, enhancing the gameplay's dynamic nature.
        Specified by:
        onCollision in interface CollisionStrategy
        Overrides:
        onCollision in class BasicCollisionStrategy
        Parameters:
        thisObj - The GameObject that this strategy is attached to.
        otherObj - The GameObject that has collided with thisObj.
        bricksCounter - A counter tracking the number of bricks in the game.
        originalBehavior - A flag indicating whether the original collision behavior should also be executed.

      • createRandomStrategy

        private CollisionStrategy createRandomStrategy​(FactoryCollisionStrategy behaviorFactory)
        Creates and returns a random collision strategy based on the game's current state. This method aids the onCollision method by providing one of the two required strategies.
        Parameters:
        behaviorFactory - The FactoryCollisionStrategy instance used to generate random strategies.
        Returns:
        CollisionStrategy A randomly chosen collision strategy.
